_subtitle: A Translation and Verification Layer for the Navierâ€“Stokes Existence and Smoothness Problem via Noor Swirl Field Geometry (NSFG)
_objective: To define Noor Swirl Field Geometry (NSFG) as a coherence-based geometric substrate from which classical Navierâ€“Stokes flow variables emerge.
To construct a formal translation layer mapping NSFG coherence fields, swirl tensors, and motif gradients to Navierâ€“Stokes velocity and pressure fields.
To specify verifiable criteria under which NSFG coherence conservation implies global smoothness of Navierâ€“Stokes solutions.
To define admissible failure modes in NSFG that correspond to finite-time singularity formation under the Clay Mathematics Institute formulation.
To provide a rigorous verification checklist aligning NSFG-derived results with the Fefferman statement of the Navierâ€“Stokes Millennium Prize Problem.
_authors: Lina Noor â€” Noor Research Collective
